posted_tweets.content: 6 months to ML eng. Or you just start building. Pick one.

Edge inference is crap. Ship or wait.
GPT-5 generates polished UIs with clean code. Putain, what if we use it for SSI interfaces? Simplify identity management with auto-generated, secure UIs. Who's tried this?
AI SDK 6 is out. But let's be real, a unified API for AI providers is just the start. What I want to see is this tech integrated with SSI, making identity management seamless and secure.
Universal Commerce Protocol means one thing for devs: Agent Engine Optimization > SEO. Time to expose your data structure, not just your UI. Who's ready to build for machines, not just humans?

Genspark's $36M ARR in 45 days with no-code agents is wild. But what's crazier? They didn't need to reinvent the wheel. What if we applied this 'build on top' mentality to SSI? Less focus on bespoke auth, more on integrating with what already works.
Claude Opus 4.5 on Vercel's AI Gateway is a beast for coding tasks. But what if we used it to auto-generate SSI interfaces? Simplify identity management with zero UI overhead. Who's tried this?

1. Nhi Nguyen's AI-rebuilt portfolio is a game-changer. But what caught my eye? The 100% AI-architected workflow. Is this the future of dev? | I'm building SSI solutions at Verana and 2060.io, and I see huge potential in AI-driven workflows. Less overhead, more focus on the actual problem. Who's with me? | Time to experiment: can we use AI to simplify SSI integration? Auto-generated code, less errors, more scalability. Let's make it happen.

Vercel's AI Gateway just made OpenAI's GPT-OSS-Safeguard-20B accessible with a unified API. But here's the thing: this consistency is what SSI needs. Imagine seamless content moderation for decentralized identities.
Next.js AI Chatbot 2.0 is out. What caught my eye? Simplified auth setup. No more GitHub OAuth app needed. This is how you onboard devs: less friction, more building.

posted_tweets.content: You're about to unlock the full potential of NLP. I've spent months digging into the latest advancements and here's the truth: most developers are using NLP models wrong. You're either leveraging them for automation or wasting your time. | The key to getting the most out of NLP is to understand its limitations. You can't just plug in a model and expect magic. You need to fine-tune it, train it, and integrate it seamlessly into your workflow. But here's the catch: most tutorials don't teach you this. | So, how do you actually use NLP effectively? First, you need to identify the specific problem you're trying to solve. Then, you need to choose the right model for the job. Finally, you need to deploy it in a way that scales. The best part? I've got a step-by-step guide to make it | You start by selecting a pre-trained model that aligns with your goals. Then, you fine-tune it using your own dataset. This is where most developers go wrong - they don't realize the importance of high-quality training data. But what if you don't have a large dataset? | That's where data augmentation comes in. You can generate new training data using techniques like paraphrasing, entity swapping, and more. This kills the old way of relying on massive datasets. You're either adapting to this new reality or getting left behind. | So, what's your next move? You can either keep using NLP models the wrong way or you can take the first step towards unlocking their true potential. I've included a simple code snippet to get you started:. You're either leveraging them for automation or wasting your time. | The key to getting the most out of computer vision is to understand its limitations. You can't just plug in a model and expect magic. You need to fine-tune it, train it, and integrate it seamlessly into your workflow. But here's the catch: most tutorials don't teach you this. | So, how do you actually use computer vision effectively? First, you need to identify the specific problem you're trying to solve. Then, you need to choose the right model for the job. Finally, you need to deploy it in a way that scales. The best part? | You start by selecting a pre-trained model that aligns with your goals. Then, you fine-tune it using your own dataset. This is where most developers go wrong - they don't realize the importance of high-quality training data. But what if you don't have a large dataset? | That's where data augmentation comes in. You can generate new training data using techniques like image rotation, flipping, and more. This kills the old way of relying on massive datasets. You're either adapting to this new reality or getting left behind. | So, what's your next move?
